ticket.title: The Rails sanitizer incorrectly remove hrefs that contain capitalized URLs
ticket.original-body: [Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test') => 'test' [Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test') => 'test' This seems to be a bug in the method `contains_bad_protocols?` in action_controller/vendor/html-scanner/html/sanitizer.rb. This method is defined as: def contains_bad_protocols?(attr_name, value) uri_attributes.include?(attr_name) && (value =~ /(^[^\/:]*):|(�*58)|(p)|(%|%)3A/ && !allowed_protocols.include?(value.split(protocol_separator).first)) end And allowed_protocols as: self.allowed_protocols = Set.new(%w(ed2k ftp http https irc mailto news gopher nntp telnet webcal xmpp callto feed svn urn aim rsync tag ssh sftp rtsp afs)) Thus: allowed_protocols.include? 'http' => true allowed_protocols.include? 'Http' => false SEE ALSO: http://stackoverflow.com/posts/4240994
ticket.latest-body: [Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test') => 'test' [Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test') => 'test' This seems to be a bug in the method `contains_bad_protocols?` in action_controller/vendor/html-scanner/html/sanitizer.rb. This method is defined as: def contains_bad_protocols?(attr_name, value) uri_attributes.include?(attr_name) && (value =~ /(^[^\/:]*):|(�*58)|(p)|(%|%)3A/ && !allowed_protocols.include?(value.split(protocol_separator).first)) end And allowed_protocols as: self.allowed_protocols = Set.new(%w(ed2k ftp http https irc mailto news gopher nntp telnet webcal xmpp callto feed svn urn aim rsync tag ssh sftp rtsp afs)) Thus: allowed_protocols.include? 'http' => true allowed_protocols.include? 'Http' => false SEE ALSO: http://stackoverflow.com/posts/4240994
ticket.original-body-html:
[Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test')

=> '<a href="http://google.com">test</a>'
[Dev]>   ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('<a href="Http://google.com">test</a>')
=> '<a>test</a>'

This seems to be a bug in the method contains_bad_protocols? in action_controller/vendor/html-scanner/html/sanitizer.rb. This method is defined as:

def contains_bad_protocols?(attr_name, value)
    uri_attributes.include?(attr_name) && 
    (value =~ /(^[^\/:]*):|(&#0*58)|(&#x70)|(%|%)3A/ 
        && !allowed_protocols.include?(value.split(protocol_separator).first))
end

And allowed_protocols as:

self.allowed_protocols = Set.new(%w(ed2k ftp http https irc mailto news gopher nntp
    telnet webcal xmpp callto feed svn urn aim rsync tag ssh sftp rtsp afs))

Thus:

allowed_protocols.include? 'http' => true
allowed_protocols.include? 'Http' => false

SEE ALSO: http://stackoverflow.com/posts/4240994

version.body: [Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test') => 'test' [Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test') => 'test' This seems to be a bug in the method `contains_bad_protocols?` in action_controller/vendor/html-scanner/html/sanitizer.rb. This method is defined as: def contains_bad_protocols?(attr_name, value) uri_attributes.include?(attr_name) && (value =~ /(^[^\/:]*):|(�*58)|(p)|(%|%)3A/ && !allowed_protocols.include?(value.split(protocol_separator).first)) end And allowed_protocols as: self.allowed_protocols = Set.new(%w(ed2k ftp http https irc mailto news gopher nntp telnet webcal xmpp callto feed svn urn aim rsync tag ssh sftp rtsp afs)) Thus: allowed_protocols.include? 'http' => true allowed_protocols.include? 'Http' => false SEE ALSO: http://stackoverflow.com/posts/4240994
version.body-html:
[Dev]> ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('test')

=> '<a href="http://google.com">test</a>'
[Dev]>   ActionController::Base.helpers.sanitize('<a href="Http://google.com">test</a>')
=> '<a>test</a>'

This seems to be a bug in the method contains_bad_protocols? in action_controller/vendor/html-scanner/html/sanitizer.rb. This method is defined as:

def contains_bad_protocols?(attr_name, value)
    uri_attributes.include?(attr_name) && 
    (value =~ /(^[^\/:]*):|(&#0*58)|(&#x70)|(%|%)3A/ 
        && !allowed_protocols.include?(value.split(protocol_separator).first))
end

And allowed_protocols as:

self.allowed_protocols = Set.new(%w(ed2k ftp http https irc mailto news gopher nntp
    telnet webcal xmpp callto feed svn urn aim rsync tag ssh sftp rtsp afs))

Thus:

allowed_protocols.include? 'http' => true
allowed_protocols.include? 'Http' => false

SEE ALSO: http://stackoverflow.com/posts/4240994
version.title: The Rails sanitizer incorrectly remove hrefs that contain capitalized URLs

version.body: Looks like a bug for me. But fix is very simple, we need just to call downcase when checking a protocol. Patch for master with test assigned.
version.body-html: Looks like a bug for me. But fix is very simple, we need just to call downcase when checking a protocol. Patch for master with test assigned.
